website_summaries.verdict: A small and quick unit that's easy to operate.
pros: A great HDMI switcher with quality components
Easy to hook up and operate
Switch quickly between devices with "Picture in Picture" mode
A bonus is that the auto switch mode can be turned off
This unit stands out for its exemplary customer service from Dinger
cons: Users report that this does not support HDCP 2.2, HDR or HDMI 2.0. products

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised-- with limitations...
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised, haven't had any issues yet. Switches easily between HDMI inputs. I currently have our Nintendo Switch and Xbox One X hooked up to it. Unfortunately this does not support HDMI 2.0 or HDR. This is important if you have a device that utilizes HDMI 2.0 or your tv's HDR technology. It will still playback 4K content, but with limitations--I found this out after buying the Xbox One X. The only solution is to purchase a different HDMI switch that supports HDMI 2.0 and HDR in order to utilize the full capabilities of certain devices.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Do not try to use for 4k
customer_reviews.text: So this product is marketed as a 4k device but it shuts down when ever 4k is activated. I have a fire tv,xbox one s and a Nintendo switch hooked up to it everything works but the xbox i even turned off 4k and made it 1080p. When ever i click to start a game it shuts down so the company sent me out anymore. Customer service is great but the one they sent out did the same thing. If u are trying to run games in 4k or 1080 this is not the product
customer_reviews.author: cleveland561

customer_reviews.title: I love it. (Will gladly come back and lay the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple setup (which, honestly, it totally should be). I did notice that I had to run my PC in "safe mode" in order to reset the video drivers, this was a slight pain but was also totally reasonable given the setup. So far, this thing works exactly as is should. Zero cons. I love it. customer_reviews.title: Works great, love it.. I like that its powered by a USB connection w/adapter

customer_reviews.author: J E (NJ)

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in, connect 4 different HDMI devices to it, plug the other end to your HDMI on the TV and you are done. Very simple and so far, extremely easy to use. Comes with a remote to flip between devices, but each time you turn on a device, it automatically senses it and switches to it. Have two hard drive turner recorders/DVD burners and two 400 Disc DVD players attached and it switches smoothly between devices. Only need the remote to override the automatic switch to the newest activated device or to swap back and forth between 2 active devices.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t purchase this item.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was easy to use. Which was it’s only good feature. Otherwise it completely washed out the color of anything that was sent through this switch. The other issue I had was that the unit kept randomly switching inputs. I’d be watching a movie and it would switch to my PS3 input, or my computer input. Not happy with it. It seemed like a great deal at the time, but now it sits in a box not being used at all. It was so bad that I manually switch the HDMI cable between all my gear manually now.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Weber

customer_reviews.title: I haven't even used the remote
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my TV set up. I got tired of having to change the inputs on my TV every time I wanted to use another device. Now I don't even have to worry. I just turn off the device I don't want to use and turn on the one I want to see and this switch outputs the one I just turned on. I haven't even used the remote controller which needs to be very close and pointed directly to the switch to work.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Rodas

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully..But..LED’s and INPUTS Are Backwards
customer_reviews.text: This little box functions quite well. A breeze to install. Mind the short power cord, the AC outlet will need to be close. Picture quality is not degraded and sound quality is not impaired. But... The LED’s in the front are completely backwards to the HDMI input positions in the back. Is that a problem, not really.. It is just funny from a technical perspective. Keeping connections and the display section LED’s intuitively placed would have been nice. In another words the LED on the right is to the rear HDMI input receptacle on the left, and so on. Overall – a safe purchase that functions as described.

customer_reviews.title: Great little switch

The remote requires line of sight, so My son says he has to hold it up sometime to get it to respond but overall that’s not a big deal for him. customer_reviews.title: Works OK, issues with IR remote and picture flickering
customer_reviews.text: As a HDMI switch, it functions alright. It can switch to the "active" device (i.e. if I power on my video game console, it will change to that input). The picture quality seems fine. The main drawback is that the IR sensor overlaps with the TV's remote, so when I change the volume up or down, it causes the screen to flicker and black out for a few seconds, which is quite annoying. The Picture-in-picture feature is ok, handy for if you switch between inputs often, but with the "active" input feature, I don't use this quite as much as I thought I would.

I tested out my HDMI wires separately and tried plugging them into different inputs on this products and it just did not work for me. I do not want to try to order a third one, so I am just returning it and will look for a different product. Would have loved it if it worked...
